lines:
Naan

98 St. James Ave om

Boston, Mass.

Feb. 14, 1917,

Dear Dr. Stearns,

Among some of the duties

which, as president of the M.I.T. Cosmopoli -
tan Olub, I am called upon to do is that of

setting speakers to address the Club from

time to time,

There are occasions for your

presence in Boston in the very near future

I hope and I wish you very much to give one

of your interesting talks. The meeting

generally takes place in the form of an in -
formal smoker, and lasts from eight to about

I ten o'clock in the evenings.

Will you please

be so kind as to tell me what day will be

most convenient for you?
raw: Naan 98 St. James Ave om Boston, Mass. Feb. 14, 1917, Dear Dr. Stearns, Among some of the duties which, as president of the M.I.T. Cosmopolitan Olub, I am called upon to do is that of setting speakers to address the Club from time to time, There are occasions for your presence in Boston in the very near future I hope and I wish you very much to give one of your interesting talks. The meeting generally takes place in the form of an informal smoker, and lasts from eight to about I ten o'clock in the evenings. Will you please be so kind as to tell me what day will be most convenient for you?

metadata.name: Phillips Academy
metadata.abstract: Letter inviting Stearns to give a talk at the MIT Cosmopolitan Club at an informal evening smoker. Kwan asks if Stearns has heard from Tommy and states that first semester went well. He studies long hours and questions whether such hardship" is worth the trouble.""etter inviting Stearns to give a tal"
